children.subject: This could be one of those 'design your own degree' case. I know that both Berkeley undergrad and phd program have a 'create your own major/degree' option.

history.content:
May be a dumb question so apologize if it is.

I have noticed that in the data gathered by the career center, there are many students got admitted to a program named Master in AI and Robotics here at Berkeley or other universities like Stanford, and it's listed seperated from general Master in CS. 

(Source: https://career.berkeley.edu/survey/survey)

I know that CMU has a dedicated master program for robotics, but is there a similar dedicated program here at Berkeley that I am not aware of? I checked cal and stanford's website but only found program that's just general Master in CS.

Thanks in advance.
history.subject: What is the "Master in Artificial Intelligence and Robotics" that shows up in career center's data?

history.content:
May be a dumb question so apologize if it is.

I have noticed that in the data gathered by the career center, there are many students got admitted to a program named Master in AI and Robotics here at Berkeley or other universities like Stanford, and it's listed seperated from general Master in CS.

I know that CMU has a dedicated master program for robotics, but is there a similar dedicated program here at Berkeley that I am not aware of? I checked cal and stanford's website but only found program that's just general Master in CS.

Thanks in advance.
